    1. calculateHash(File, String)

Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.utils.FileUtils
public final class FileUtils extends Object
This utility class contains a method for calculating a digest for a file. It is preferable to use calculateHash(File, String) because the method will return immediately when the thread has been interrupted, which is especially useful if it is in the middle of calculating a digest for a very large file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Optional<String>
    calculateHash(File file, String algorithm)
    Calculates a digest for the given file using the given algorithm (e.g., MD5 or SHA-256).

  • Method Details

    • calculateHash

      public static Optional<String> calculateHash(File file, String algorithm)
      Calculates a digest for the given file using the given algorithm (e.g., MD5 or SHA-256). At every iteration, the method checks if the thread that is calculating the digest has been interrupted. If it has, the thread will return immediately.
      Parameters:
      file - The file for which to calculate a digest.
      algorithm - The algorithm to use.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing a digest, or an empty Optional if the thread has been interrupted or an I/O exception occurred.
